what-it-does: Checks for index-based list accesses during enumerate iterations.
why-is-this-bad:
When iterating over a list with enumerate, the current item is already
available alongside its index. Using the index to look up the item is
unnecessary.
example:
letters = ["a", "b", "c"]

for index, letter in enumerate(letters):
    print(letters[index])



Use instead:


letters = ["a", "b", "c"]

for index, letter in enumerate(letters):
    print(letter)
